page.title: 20RED RUM
page.content: Red Rum is the only race horse in history to have won the Grand National,a steeplechase,held in March or April,about 4.5 miles long with approximately 30 jumps,3 times in a row.He did this in 1973 1974 and 1977.He is now 21 years old,and has retired to Southport where he lives with 25-30 other horses at his owners stables.Every Sunday Wednesday and Friday mornings Red Rum and the other horses in Ginger McCaines care,go cantering along Southport beach,as the salt in the water strengthens their legs and the salt does not wear down their shoes as much as stone.Red Rum is a big celebrity in Southport,there is a bronze bust of him in Wayfarers Arcade,and he is open to the public at his stables 8 hours a day.He can regularly be seen opening fetes and galas.
